intro: Wageneria montana, commonly known as the mountain wageneria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a subtle scent when crushed. Wageneria montana is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
